discussion.p: The atomic_itype types and atomic_address have two overloads of operator=; one is volatile qualified, and the other is not. atomic_bool only has the volatile qualified version:
On a non-volatile-qualified object this is ambiguous with the deleted copy-assignment operator
due to the need for a single standard conversion in each case when assigning a bool to an atomic_bool as in:
discussion.note: Proposed resolution as of NB comment:
